I use this space to post tutorials and ocassionaly blog 
about anything related to data analysis. I also use twitter 
to curate information about linguistics, R, reproducible 
research, data analysis/visualization, and related links.


<ul class="posts">

```{r echo = F, results = 'asis', cache=FALSE, eval=TRUE}
link_open <- "<li itemscope itemtype=\"//schema.org/BlogPosting\">
  <a href=\""
link_close <- "\" itemprop=\"url\">"
date_wrap <- "<div class=\"p-wrap\"><time datetime=\"\" itemprop=\"datePublished\">&lt;<span class=\"p-attr\">p</span> <span class=\"class-attr\">class</span>=<span class=\"date-attr\">\"date\"</span>><span class=\"baffle\">"
title_wrap <- "</span>&lt;/<span class=\"p-attr\">p</span>> </time><p itemprop=\"name headline\">&lt;<span class=\"title-attr\">title</span>><span class=\"baffle\">"
post_close <- "</span>&lt;/<span class=\"title-attr\">title</span>></p> </div> </a> </li>"



posts <- dir('./blog', full = TRUE)
linkName <- gsub("_", " ", posts)
linkName <- gsub("(^|[[:space:]])([[:alpha:]])", "\\1\\U\\2", linkName, perl = TRUE)
library(stringr)
date <- substr(linkName, 8, 17)
postName <- substr(linkName, 19, 80)
link <- paste0(link_open, 
               posts, 
               "/index.html", 
               link_close, 
               date_wrap, 
               date, 
               title_wrap, 
               postName, 
               post_close)
length <- length(posts) - 4
writeLines(link[rev(seq(length))])
```
